title: Electrostatic force on electron in atom

content.question: An electron is at a distance of <math alttext="2.5 times 10 raised to the negative 11 power meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>11</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>m</mtext></math> from an alpha particle. Which of the following correctly approximates the magnitude and indicates the direction of the electrostatic force exerted on the electron by the alpha particle?

choices.label: <math alttext="7.4 times 10 raised to the negative 7 power newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math> toward the alpha particle

<math alttext="7.4 times 10 raised to the negative 7 power newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math> away from the alpha particle

<math alttext="3.7 times 10 raised to the negative 18 power newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math> toward the alpha particle

<math alttext="3.7 times 10 raised to the negative 18 power newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>7</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math> away from the alpha particle

content.answer: <math alttext="7.4 times 10 raised to the negative 7 power newton" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>7</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>N</mtext></math> toward the alpha particle

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
